alert.note: Alert for Abbeville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 8:17AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Abbeville County in upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 814 AM EST, With additional heavy rain likely this morning, rainfall will total around 4 inches in spots. Widespread high water conditions and flooding of low-lying areas will linger virtually countywide. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Abbeville, Calhoun Falls, Lake Secession, Lowndesville, Lake Strom Thurmond and Lake Russell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
